ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Processing Disorder (Corpus Callosum Syndrome)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Left ear extinction on dichotic tasks and bilateral deficits on duration patterns despite normal peripheral hearing, consistent with the MRI-confirmed lesion of the posterior corpus callosum.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Evaluate interhemispheric transfer and dichotic listening performance.
Evaluate interhemispheric transfer with linguistically loaded stimuli.
Evaluate interhemispheric transfer with digit stimuli.
Assess temporal processing and interhemispheric transfer.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Peripheral hearing and monaural speech recognition were normal. Central testing revealed a classic 'left ear extinction' pattern on dichotic tasks (Rhyme and CVs), consistent with a lesion of the posterior corpus callosum preventing transfer of right-hemisphere input to the language-dominant left hemisphere. Duration patterns were abnormal bilaterally, indicating a deficit in temporal sequencing/transfer. Dichotic digits showed less suppression than other stimuli, possibly due to different transfer pathways or cross-cueing.

tests.name: Dichotic Rhyme Test
tests.result_summary: Significant left ear suppression (~10%); Right ear score above normal range (~90%).

tests.name: Dichotic CVs
tests.result_summary: Complete left ear suppression (0%); Right ear normal (100%).

tests.name: Dichotic Digits
tests.result_summary: Left ear depressed (~80%) but better than CVs/Rhyme; Right ear normal (~95%).

counseling_actions: Explain the 'Left Ear Extinction' phenomenon where the left ear input is blocked by competition in the right ear due to the brain lesion.
Discuss difficulties with temporal patterning and sequencing, which are relevant to his work as a sound engineer.
Recommend compensatory strategies such as directing important conversations to the right ear.
Advise avoiding high-interference environments when critical listening is required.

escalation.rationale_short: Routine follow-up for cognitive sequelae of the aneurysm; no acute otologic emergency.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor long-term cognitive and auditory processing recovery.

expected_outcome: Continued experience of mild cognitive problems.
